result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald K Constantineau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any sentence Defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution - joint and several. Restitution amended per 2/2016 Amended Restitution Summary & Order

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or school.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall have no contact with Chad Goeman, Owen Masters and the Silver Bell Motel unless authorized by Defendant's Probation Agent.  
Defendant shall not associate with any known drug dealers or users.
Defendant shall not be present in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.  
Defendant shall notify all health care providers of addiction history.
Defendant shall notify Probation Agent within 48 hours of any prescription medication change.
Defendant shall submit to Probation Agent proof of any incoming and outgoing monies.
Court waives DNA sample and fee.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Discussion between Court and counsel regarding PSI.  Statements by Judy G., Karen C. and Jim C.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Letter received from Atty. Borkowicz w/attachments
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel
Confidential
Copy; 1/21/16; Fox Lake Correctional Institution
Disposition Form
Sentencing hearing at 01-21-2016 02:00 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.   Resolution reached; Defense has no objection to proceeding without a written Information.  State moves to dismiss and read in 15CF363, 14CM1334 and 15CM763 and Court so orders.  State further moves to strike the repeater allegation on Ct. 1 and Court so orders.  PSI recommended with both sides free to argue. State agrees not to exceed three years of initial confinement with no cap on extended supervision.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.   Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information within 48 hours.
Victim requests to be present for sentencing hearing
Dodge Correctional - 10/7/15
Hearing at 10-07-2015 01:15 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Defendant has new charges pending; global resolution anticipated.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Motion for Discovery & Inspection
No contact with co-def OM, River Horse West, or CG
Hearing at 09-16-2015 08:15 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Alyssa Armbrust from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State. Co-defendant case with Owen Masters.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant is on a PO hold.  State requests significant cash bond.  Argument on bond.  $2,500 signature bond set.  SPD will appoint Atty. Brian Borkewicz.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with counsel.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
